page.title: 04WRITTLE, CEREAL CROPS GROWN
page.content: Most of the fields surrounding Writtle are used for cereal crops.Avalon is a type of winter wheat used for milling to make high-grade flour for bread. Some winter wheat that is grown is milled and used either for animal feed or as low-quality biscuit flour. Spring barley is sown in April and harvested in August or September. The barley is used for malting or stock-feed.The spring oats that we saw growing are used for horse-feed. One farmer grew Spring beans. These beans are the size of small peas and are used for feed for tame pigeons or exported to Saudi Arabia where they are used for stock-feed. Rye and clover grass is cut and used for hay for horses,some grass is cut and stored in huge polythene bags until it becomes silage for cows.
